description:
The Collapse transition is used by the
[Vertical Stepper](/components/steppers/#vertical-stepper) StepContent component.
It uses [react-transition-group](https://github.com/reactjs/react-transition-group) internally.
propChildren: The content node to be collapsed.
propClasses: Override or extend the styles applied to the component.
propCollapsedSize: The width (horizontal) or height (vertical) of the container when collapsed.
propComponent:
The component used for the root node.
Either a string to use a HTML element or a component.
propIn: If `true`, the component will transition in.
propTimeout:
The duration for the transition, in milliseconds.
You may specify a single timeout for all transitions, or individually with an object.

Set to 'auto' to automatically calculate transition time based on height.
stylesRoot: Styles applied to the root element.
stylesHorizontal: Pseudo-class applied to the root element if `orientation="horizontal"`.
stylesEntered: Styles applied to the root element when the transition has entered.
stylesHidden: Styles applied to the root element when the transition has exited and `collapsedSize` != 0px.
stylesWrapper: Styles applied to the outer wrapper element.
stylesWrapperInner: Styles applied to the inner wrapper element.
